title: Scott Amendola Band - Believe (2005)
description: Cryptogramophone: CG123 http://www.cryptogramophone.com/catalog/believe http://extranet.cryptogramophone.com/cg123.shtml * Jenny Scheinman: violin * Nels Cline : 6 string guitars, 12 string guitars, lap steel guitar * Jeff Parker : guitar * John Shifflett : bass * Scott Amendola : drums, percussion, loops, live electronic, treatments, electric mbira, melodica http://www.jennyscheinman.com/ http://www.nelscline.com/ http://www.jeffparkersounds.com/ http://www.johnshifflett.com/ http://www.scottamendola.com/ Recorded by Jeff Cressman at Möbius Music, San Francisco, California (CA), on August 22-23, 2004. Reviews ~~~~~~~ By William Tilland http://www.allmusic.com/album/believe-mw0000213488 Drummer Scott Amendola maintains his high standards on his third recording as a leader (and his second on the Cryptogramophone label). In short, this is another great release, filled with passion, drama, humor, and the sundry joys of superior collective improvisation. As always with Amendola, eclecticism is assumed, but he enriches the mix this time by including Jeff Parker from Tortoise, who provides a second electric guitar alongside Nels Cline, while Jenny Scheinman's violin completes the string trio front line... -- By John Kelman http://www.allaboutjazz.com/believe-cryptogramophone-review-by-john-kelman.php By Michael McCaw http://www.allaboutjazz.com/believe-scott-amendola-cryptogramophone-review-by-michael-mccaw.php By Bill Milkowski http://jazztimes.com/reviews/drum-beat/scott-amendola-band-believe/ By Jeff Melton http://expose.org/index.php/articles/display/scott-amendola-band-believe-4.html Por Marcelo Morales (es) http://elintruso.com/2005/09/17/scott-amendola-band-believe/
